title: The Answer Studio Album Discography
description:
The Answer are an Northern Irish hard rock and blues-rock band from Newcastle and Downpatrick, County Down, Northern Ireland. They have achieved success with their debut album Rise selling in excess of 30,000 copies in the UK & Europe, 10,000 on day one in Japan and 100,000 worldwide.

Rise (SPECIAL EDITION) IN. FLAC.

CD 1

01) Under The Sky
02) Never Too Late
03) Come Follow Me
04) Be What You Want
05) Memphis Water
06) No Questions Asked
07) Into the Gutter
08) Sometimes Your Love
09) Leavin' Today
10) Preachin'
11) Always

CD 2

01) Keep Believin' (Unreleased Chris Sheldon Version)
02) I Wont Let You Down (Unreleased Version From Rise Sessions)
03) Sweet Emotion (From the Kerrang! 25 Year CD)
04) Doctor (Unreleased Version From Rise Sessions)
05) So Cold (Unreleased Version From Rise Sessions)
06) Rock Bottom Blues (B Side)
07) Some Unity (B Side)
08) No Questions Asked (Live Session Version)
09) Into The Gutter (Acoustic Session)
10) Only The Strong Survive (Unreleased Version From Rise Sessions)
11) Not Listening (Unreleased Version From Rise Sessions)
12) Come Follow Me (Live In Tokyo)
13) Sometimes Your Love (Live In Tokyo)
14) Be What You Want/Moment Jam (Live In Tokyo)
15) Take It Easy (Unreleased Version From Rise Sessions)

*The songs "Come Follow Me", "Sometimes Your Love" and "Be What You Want/Moment" are also available on the Everyday Demons special edition CDs.*


Everyday Demons (32OKBPS MP3)

01) Demon Eyes
02) Too Far Gone
03) On And On
04) Cry Out
05) Why'd You Change Your Mind
06) Pride
07) Walkin' Mat
08) Tonight
09) Dead Of The Night
10)Comfort Zone
11) Evil Man

Sorry, but i couldnt get the bonus tracks at the time.




Anyway, i've seen this band live, and they were amazing. It convinced me to get their albums. I would recommend this to anyone who loved the old Classic Rock, in the style of AC/DC, Boston, Foreigner, et cetera.


Thank you, and please seed :)
